title: 'IEDs packed in tiffin boxes, wireless sets seized': Terror hideout busted in Poonch
content: Security forces in Jammu and Kashmir's Poonch district discovered a large cache of arms and ammunition from a destroyed terrorist hideout, including IEDs and wireless sets. This discovery follows a recent deadly terror attack in Pahalgam, prompting heightened security measures across the state with increased checkpoints and deployments.

title: Real blow to Pakistan! India chokes $500m goods via third countries
content: Following the Pahalgam attack, India has banned all imports from Pakistan, including indirect routes via intermediary nations, postal services, and vessels. This action, triggered by national security concerns, aims to prevent Pakistani goods from entering India through circumvention.

title: Revenge, rivalry, Rs 5L deal: Suhas Shetty murder linked to 2022 Fazil killing?
content: Police arrested eight individuals in connection with the murder of Suhas Shetty, revealing a revenge plot fueled by personal grudges. Abdul Safwan, targeted by Shetty's associates in 2023, allegedly orchestrated the murder with financial and logistical support from Adil Mehroof, whose brother was murdered in 2022, with Shetty named as an accused.

title: SC rejects woman's plea claiming possession of Red Fort as legal 'heir'
content: The Supreme Court dismissed Sultana Begum's plea to reclaim the Red Fort, deeming her claim as the widow of Bahadur Shah Zafar II’s great-grandson misconceived and meritless. The court questioned why only the Red Fort was being claimed and not other historical sites. Begum argued her family was wrongfully deprived of the fort after the 1857 war of independence.

title: Arshdeep Singh: The left-arm quick India need in England
content: With his skill to swing the ball both ways and his dexterity to hit the 6m length consistently, Arshdeep Singh is arguably the best of his type India has had since Zaheer Khan. The 26-year-old's opening spell against Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) is a gentle reminder to Ajit Agarkar and co. of why he should be on the plane for the five-match Test series against England, starting June 20.

title: Ray Dalio says Donald Trump’s tariff war is pushing America close to a recession
content: Ray Dalio, who predicted the 2008 crisis, warns that mishandled economic policies, particularly Trump's tariffs, could push the U.S. into a recession. He likens the tariffs' disruptive implementation to destabilizing the production system. Despite a tariff pause, Goldman Sachs estimates a significant chance of a recession within the next year, highlighting growing economic uncertainty.

title: Indian student in US arrested for impersonating a 'federal agent' to dupe woman
content: Kishan Kumar Singh, an Indian student, was arrested in North Carolina for allegedly impersonating a federal agent. He is accused of scamming a 78-year-old woman by convincing her that her bank accounts were compromised. Singh is currently held on a $1 million bond, facing felony charges for his alleged crimes.

title: 'Maybe it’s time he says, Pooran, you take ...': Finch's bold advice for Pant
content: Aaron Finch suggests Rishabh Pant relinquish wicketkeeping to Nicholas Pooran to improve communication and leadership amid a poor IPL season. Pant's struggles with both batting and captaincy, highlighted by a slow scoring rate and on-field frustrations, are impacting LSG's performance. Finch believes this change could help Pant regain rhythm and directly manage the team's strategies, crucial for their playoff push.

title: Pahalgam attack: IAF on alert, Rafales ready for swift strike as tensions soar
content: Amid escalating tensions, the IAF chief briefed PM Modi on operational readiness, including long-range fighter sorties and heightened air defense. This meeting, following a similar briefing from the Navy chief, underscores India's preparedness for potential punitive strikes against Pakistan. The IAF is conducting regular combat air patrols and increasing operational readiness platforms, with Rafales equipped for swift action.

title: Warren Buffet: I am somewhat embarrassed to say Apple CEO Tim Cook ...
content: Warren Buffett, the legendary investor, acknowledged Tim Cook's role in Berkshire Hathaway's success. He credited Apple's CEO for significant financial gains. Buffett announced his retirement at the annual meeting. This marked the end of an era. Greg Abel, the vice chairman, is set to succeed Buffett. Abel will lead Berkshire with a focus on long-term value.

title: Shubman Gill being groomed for Test captaincy?
content: The Indian selection committee, led by Ajit Agarkar, is set to announce the squad for the England tour in May, with captaincy a key point of discussion. While Rohit Sharma's recent performance and Jasprit Bumrah's injury raise questions, the BCCI is considering Shubman Gill for a leadership role, potentially as vice-captain.

title: Goa stampede: Police directives on CCTV cameras, barricades not implemented ahead of temple fest
content: The temple authorities said there wasn’t enough time to install the CCTV cameras, as the meeting was held just a couple of days before the event

title: World Bank executive director Parameswaran Iyer to represent India at IMF board
content: Parameswaran Iyer's nomination was necessitated to fill a vacancy created with the termination of services of K.V. Subramanian as the executive director at the IMF

title: SC junks plea of woman claiming possession of iconic Red Fort
content: Petitioner Sultana Begum claimed to be the widow of great-grandson of Mughal emperor Bahadur Shah Zafar-II

title: CM Mamata Banerjee likely to visit riot-hit Murshidabad on Monday
content: West Bengal CM to visit violence-hit Murshidabad district to meet victims; unveil schemes worth ₹703 crore

title: Waqf Act hearing LIVE: Supreme Court to hear batch of pleas challenging Waqf (Amendment) Act
content: The Centre assured the Supreme Court on April 17 that it would neither denotify waqf properties, including ‘waqf by user’, nor make any appointments to the Central Waqf Council and boards

title: Priyanka Gandhi welcomes Centre's announcement to conduct caste census
content: Ms. Gandhi said that pressure from people across the country seemed to have made a difference in the Government’s stance.

title: Enforcement Directorate arrests 'absconding' former Haryana Congress MLA
content: The money-laundering case stems from a Gurugram Police FIR filed against Sai Aaina Farms and associated companies

title: US President Trump Says He's Willing To Lower China Tariffs For This Reason
content: President Donald Trump has signalled he is open to lowering massive tariffs imposed on China, as he acknowledged that the current levies are so high that the two of the world's largest economies have essentially stopped doing business with each other

title: Now Is The Time To Invest In India's Long-Term Outlook Growth Story: Morgan Stanley
content: Global brokerage Morgan Stanley has reaffirmed its positive long-term outlook on Indian equities, highlighting that India is likely to outperform in a global bear market scenario.

title: Video: Thar SUV Runs Over Delhi Security Guard Who Opposed Honking
content: A man ran over a security guard with his Thar SUV in Delhi's Mahipalpur after the latter asked him to stop honking.

title: "Pakistan PR": BJP Slams Congress Over UP Leader's Nimbu-Mirchi Rafale Dig
content: Congress leader Ajay Rai's "nimbu mirchi" swipe at the Centre, in which he used a toy plane to question why Rafale fighters are parked in hangars when they should be out avenging the Pahalgam terror attack, has sparked a massive political row

title: "Don't Have Additional Water": Bhagwant Mann On Sharing Water With Haryana
content: Amid the escalating water-sharing dispute with Haryana, Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann on Monday stated that Punjab has no surplus water to spare, emphasising that legal and data-driven evidence supports the state's stance.

title: Unseasonal Fog, Rain Surprise Tourists In Rajasthan's Mount Abu
content: Weather in Rajasthan's Mount Abu changed suddenly on Sunday night when cloudy skies were followed by light rain in the area.

title: India's Water Warning To Pak As It Blocks Flow Through Jammu Dam On Chenab
content: Following its decision to suspend the Indus Water Treaty in retaliation for the Pahalgam terror attack, India briefly stopped water flow through the Baglihar dam on the Chenab river

title: Congress Leader Sparks Row With 'Rafale' Stunt, BJP's "Joke" Jibe
content: Uttar Pradesh Congress chief Ajay Rai stoked controversy for criticising the Central government for their "big talk and no action" following the Pahalgam attack.

title: Room Of Tears, Fisherman's Ring: What Happens While Electing A New Pope
content: Cardinals will gather on May 7 in a conclave in the Vatican's Sistine Chapel to elect a new Pope, days after Pope Francis death.

title: 30 Influencers Rescued After Lamborghini Yacht Sinks Off Miami Beach
content: A group of around 30 bikini-clad influencers decided to take a luxurious Lamborghini Tecnomar yacht - meant for five people - for a ride in Miami Beach.

title: World's 1st Rice Variety Using 21st Century "Genome Editing" Produced In India
content: Indian scientists have made history by producing two new climate-smart rice varieties using a 21st century breeding technology called "genome editing"

title: Spain's Huge Power Blackout Is a Wake-Up Call For India
content: Politicians in New Delhi have correctly noted that solar and wind power meet three requirements they view as crucial.

title: Gold prices off record highs; Gold June futures start higher today
content: Gold futures opened higher at Rs 93,271/10 grams, while silver saw a slight increase to Rs 94,145/kg. Prices previously declined due to optimism surrounding US-China trade talks and a stronger dollar.

title: Prabhsimran bats for ailing father, undergoing dialysis thrice a week
content: Prabhsimran Singh's explosive batting for Punjab Kings in the IPL is a source of joy for his ailing father, Surjit Singh, who is battling kidney failure. Despite his health struggles, Surjit finds solace and happiness in watching his son's performance. Prabhsimran has produced 437 runs in 11 innings for PBKS at a strike rate of 170.

title: Elon Musk is no longer ‘Elon Musk’ on Twitter; changes his profile name to…
content: Elon Musk has once again altered his X display name, this time to 'Groklon Rust,' sparking speculation about its meaning. The moniker appears to blend references to Grok, Musk's AI chatbot, and the Rust programming language, potentially linked to xAI's infrastructure.

title: Congress leader's 'toy Rafale' jibe amplified by Pak media, draws BJP's ire
content: Bharatiya Janata Party leaders have strongly criticized the Congress, accusing the grand old party of demoralizing the Indian armed forces after Ajay Rai's "toy Rafale jet" comment was amplified by Pakistani media. BJP spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla hit out at the Congress, calling it a deliberate act of cooperation with Pakistan.

title: 'Captain came up with the move': Ponting hails Shreyas' tactical call
content: Punjab Kings' head coach Ricky Ponting lauded Shreyas Iyer's captaincy, particularly the strategic promotion of Josh Inglis, which proved pivotal in their dominant victory against Lucknow Super Giants. Inglis' aggressive innings against Mayank Yadav shifted the momentum, while Prabhsimran Singh's explosive 91 and Arshdeep Singh's impactful bowling further solidified PBKS's win, propelling them to second place in the table.

title: 'My brother took up cause': Priyanka says govt 'pressured' for caste census
content: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra stated that the central government's agreement to include caste enumeration in the upcoming census is due to pressure, highlighting Rahul Gandhi's advocacy on the issue. Jairam Ramesh criticized PM Modi for a "U-turn" on the caste census, noting the government's prior opposition.

title: Google changes its appraisal program, VP to employees: "We want to be upfront that..."
content: Google is revamping its employee performance review system to reward top performers with increased bonuses and equity, aiming to incentivize high achievement across the company. To fund these enhanced rewards for those achieving "Outstanding Impact," the company will slightly reduce bonus and equity multipliers for employees with "Significant Impact" and "Moderate Impact" ratings, ensuring a budget-neutral adjustment.

title: Trump plans to reopen Alcatraz: 10 things to know about the infamous prison
content: US President Donald Trump has proposed the rebuilding and reopening of Alcatraz prison to house the United States' most dangerous criminals, citing the need for a stricter approach to violent offenders. The US president has directed several federal agencies to collaborate on this project, envisioning an enlarged and rebuilt facility.

title: 'Stupid': Former Pakistani cricketers hit out at Gavaskar for Asia Cup remarks
content: Pakistani cricket legends, including Javed Miandad and Basit Ali, have expressed disappointment over Sunil Gavaskar's comments regarding Pakistan's Asia Cup participation. Gavaskar suggested political tensions might prevent Pakistan's inclusion, a statement Miandad found hard to believe, given their past camaraderie.

title: Warren Buffet says Apple under Cook has contributed to Berkshire more than ...
content: Warren Buffett lauded Tim Cook's leadership at Apple, acknowledging his significant contribution to Berkshire Hathaway's financial gains. Despite reducing Berkshire's Apple stake, Buffett emphasized Cook's unique ability to develop Apple, drawing a comparison to Steve Jobs. Since Cook became CEO in 2011, Apple's stock has surged, driving its market capitalization to over $3 trillion.

title: Sensex up over 500 points, crosses 81,000 mark; Nifty50 above 24,500
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Monday and rallied strongly. While Nifty50 crossed the 24,500 mark, BSE Sensex was above 81,000.

title: 'Call Dhoni, watch old videos': Sehwag's advice to out-of-form Rishabh Pant
content: Virender Sehwag advises struggling Rishabh Pant to rediscover his dominant form by reviewing past successes and maintaining his routine. Following a string of low scores and a concerning strike rate, Sehwag suggests Pant reconnect with his old self and seek guidance from MS Dhoni to clear doubts and regain confidence.

title: 'Hollywood dying': Trump announces 100% tariffs for movies produced outside US
content: US President Donald Trump's recent announcement of a 100% tariff on foreign-made films has sparked concerns about a potential trade war. Citing the decline of Hollywood and alleged propaganda, Trump aims to revitalize American movie production. However, this move adds to existing trade tensions, particularly with China, impacting global supply chains.

title: Amid India-Pak tensions, Pakistan MP says he’ll head to England if war begins
content: A Pakistani politician, Sher Afzal Khan Marwat from Imran Khan's PTI, stated he would flee to England if war with India broke out. This statement comes amid heightened tensions following a terrorist attack in Jammu and Kashmir. India has said it will pursue the preparators of the the Pahalgam attack.

title: Adani’s reps meet Trump officials; want end to US bribery cases
content: Gautam Adani's representatives have reportedly engaged with Donald Trump's administration officials to potentially dismiss criminal charges against him in a foreign bribery investigation.

title: When Kohli revealed the secret behind his nickname ‘Chiku’
content: Virat Kohli, fondly known as 'Chiku,' owes his nickname to MS Dhoni's on-field mention and a childhood resemblance to a comic book character. Kohli clarified a recent social media interaction with Avneet Kaur's fan page, attributing it to an algorithmic error. This explanation followed a wave of speculation and memes online, highlighting the cricketer's constant presence in the news.

title: Morning news wrap: Pakistan violates ceasefire again, SC to hear Waqf plea; and more
content: Recent tensions escalate as Pakistan Army initiates unprovoked firing across the LoC, and with Pakistan demanding UNSC consultations. The Supreme Court is set to decide on the Waqf Amendment Act. Meanwhile, US President Trump imposes a 100% tariff on foreign films, citing threats to Hollywood. In sports, Rishabh Pant attributes LSG's defeat to misjudging conditions and costly errors.

title: How coffee agroforests can play a role in ecological restoration
content: A recent study by the Nature Conservation Foundation, in collaboration with owners and managers of agroforests in Hassan and Chikkamagaluru districts, demonstrates the potential of coffee agrosystems as refuge for biodiversity

title: Shaping the port of the future
content: The Vizhinjam port is of immense significance to India’s global maritime trade.  Amongst all existing Indian ports, Vizhinjam is the closest to international shipping routes. Many global shipping stakeholders have already appreciated the role the port is going to play in transshipment

title: BSF to get 16 new battalions, 2 field HQs for Pakistan, Bangladesh borders
content: The paramilitary force has 193 battalions as of now to guard the two fronts. A battalion of the border force consists of over 1,000 troopers. Hence, the overall strength of the 16 new battalions will be around 17,000 personnel

title: Heavy rain brings respite from heat, but throws life out of gear in Vijayawada
content: Collector ensures NEET aspirants did not face any transportation issue, urges people to stay cautious

title: Boy dies after falling into overflowing drain in Machavaram
content: The boy reportedly fell in an overflowing drain. Local residents and the boy’s mother noticed Manikanta in the drain and shifted him to hospital, where the doctors declared him as ‘brought dead’

title: Telangana High Court judge Justice M.G. Priyadarsini passes away
content: The mortal remains of the judge were kept at Villa No. 14, Vasanth City, Hafeezpet. The last rites would be performed at 12 p.m. at Jubilee Hills Mahaprasthanam on May 5

title: Supreme Court to hear batch of pleas challenging Waqf (Amendment) Act today
content: The Centre assured the Supreme Court on April 17 that it would neither denotify waqf properties, including ‘waqf by user’, nor make any appointments to the Central Waqf Council and boards till May 5

title: Will remain in NDA, no more about turns: Nitish Kumar
content: The Bihar CM, who has changed partners several times, said, ‘My party made me go here and there a couple of times. But this won’t happen again. It was late Atal Bihari Vajpayee who made me (the CM)‘

title: Amid India-Pakistan tension, 30-minute blackout drill held at Ferozepur Cantonment
content: The BSF has intensified patrolling along the international border while Punjab Police has set up checkpoints at all strategic locations as a precautionary measure

title: Al-based imaging, research centre opened at medical college hospital
content: The RADAR centre aims to enhance precision diagnostics through AI-enabled imaging, improving the accuracy of patient’s diagnosis and care

title: Broadway bus terminus in city awaits revamp
content: The ₹822.7-crore project is to transform the hub into a Multi-Modal Facility Complex; While CMDA waits for Corporation to hand over the site, civic officials say they have not received any file from it

title: T.N. Chief Minister to announce nationalisation of books of five Tamil scholars today
content: Stalin will attend the valedictory of ‘Tamil Week’. As part of this, various literary events were held across the State since April 29 to mark the birth anniversary of poet Pavendhar Bharathidasan

title: Terrorists Involved In Pahalgam Attack Had Military Training In Pakistan: Sources
content: 26 people, including one Nepali national, were killed and many others were injured as multiple terrorists descended on Baisaran Valley, known as "Mini Switzerland".

title: Tiny Sparkles, Big Environmental Threat: Glitter's Dark Side
content: Glitter is festive and fun - a favourite for decorations, makeup and art projects. But while it may look harmless, beautiful even, glitter's sparkle hides a darker side.

title: Bengaluru MBA Graduate Arrested For Harassing Woman Near Tech Park
content: Sreekanth Kodanda Reddy allegedly harassed the woman while she was walking in Ecoworld in the Marathahalli area last Wednesday.

title: Elon Musk Changes Name To 'Groklon Rust' On X, Sparks Buzz On Social Media
content: The name change came a day after Elon Musk revealed X would now integrate artificial intelligence to enhance user experience.

title: Astronaut Or Space Tourist? Debate Rages Over Who Gets The Title
content: The recent all-women spaceflight carried out on Jeff Bezos's Blue Origin vehicle has raised discussion of who gets to be called an astronaut.

title: Mamata Banerjee Likely To Visit Violence-Hit Murshidabad Today
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee is likely to travel to violence-hit Murshidabad district on a two-day visit on Monday, an official said.

title: Telangana Man Scales Manipur's Highest Peak To Raise Drug Abuse Awareness
content: A 20-year-old mountaineer from Telangana scaled Manipur's highest peak Mount Iso also known as Mount Tempu in Senapati district to spread the message against drug abuse and betting apps.

title: Gold price prediction: What's the gold rate outlook for this week?
content: Gold price prediction: Last week, gold prices experienced their worst weekly decline in over two months, retreating from record highs due to easing trade tensions and mixed U.S. economic signals. Renewed trade talks between the U.S. and China, coupled with Trump's tariff relief measures, shifted investor interest towards the dollar and bonds.

title: ‘My party made me go here and there’: Nitish Kumar on staying with NDA
content: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar, acknowledging the Bharatiya Janata Party's role in his initial rise to power under then-Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee, has pledged his unwavering commitment to the BJP-led National Democratic Alliance. The Bihar CM attributed his past departures to party colleagues, specifically pointing to Lallan Singh's influence.

title: 'Hurt us badly': Pant reveals major reason behind LSG's defeat vs PBKS
content: Lucknow Super Giants suffered a setback against Punjab Kings. The team lost by 37 runs. Rishabh Pant cited dropped catches as a key factor. Punjab Kings posted a formidable 236/5. Lucknow Super Giants only managed 199/7 in response. Ayush Badoni and Abdul Samad fought hard. Lucknow Super Giants now need to win their remaining matches.

title: IPL 2025: Ayush Mhatre shows form, finesse beyond his years
content: Seventeen-year-old Ayush Mhatre's impressive 94 off 48 balls against Royal Challengers Bengaluru highlights Chennai Super Kings' shift towards youth. Despite the loss, Mhatre's maturity and aggressive batting have drawn high praise from coach Stephen Fleming. His seamless integration into the CSK camp and ability to perform under pressure suggest a promising future with the franchise.

title: UNSC to discuss rising India-Pakistan tensions after Pahalgam terror attack
content: Pakistan has requested an emergency meeting with the United Nations Security Council to address its escalating tensions with India, citing concerns over alleged aggressive actions and the suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty. The UNSC, under the presidency of Greece, scheduled closed consultations for May 5 to discuss the matter.

title: IPL match today, SRH vs DC: All you need to know
content: Delhi Capitals, seeking to reignite their playoff aspirations, are set to clash with a struggling Sunrisers Hyderabad in a crucial IPL 2025 encounter. Axar Patel's fitness remains a concern as DC aims to overcome a two-match losing streak at home. SRH, despite boasting big names, are desperate to find form, making this match a high-stakes affair at Arun Jaitley Stadium.

title: Supreme Court to decide today if interim order needed on waqf pleas
content: The Supreme Court will decide on Monday regarding interim orders on petitions challenging the Waqf Amendment Act, 2025, concerning its impact on traditional Islamic ties and religious freedom. The Centre defends the Act as secular, countering claims of religious interference and emphasizing the need to prevent misuse of the 2013 amendment, which allegedly led to encroachment on properties.

title: Special session of Punjab House today to discuss water release to Haryana
content: Punjab's assembly will convene a special session due to a water-sharing dispute with Haryana, triggered by the Centre's directive for Punjab to release additional water. Punjab is resisting, claiming it lacks surplus water, leading to escalated tensions ahead of annual water allocation. Political solidarity is seen in Punjab, while Haryana defends its demand, intensifying the conflict.

title: Parents throw cake party to cheer up son who failed SSLC exams in K'taka
content: In Bagalkot, the parents of Abhishek Cholachagudda, who failed his SSLC exams, chose a unique way to support him. Instead of scolding him, they organized a cake-cutting ceremony to celebrate his effort. The family, including his parents, sister, and grandmother, encouraged Abhishek to retake the exam and achieve success, turning a moment of disappointment into one of motivation.

title: Caste census: Congress targets BJP with SC affidavit, Parl reply
content: Despite Congress's claim that PM Modi reversed his stance on caste enumeration due to their pressure, the party highlighted the government's 2021 decision against a caste census and its plea to the Supreme Court to avoid ordering one. Congress is now questioning Modi's apparent U-turn and directing state units to rally for caste census implementation and the removal of reservation barriers.

title: Laughter Chefs: Krushna Abhishek breaks praising aunt Geeta for keeping her promise
content: Laughter Chefs season 2 takes an emotional turn with the contestants' mothers joining them on stage. Elvish seeks guidance from his mom, while Reem gets playfully roasted. Krushna shares a heartfelt story about his mother's best friend, Geeta, who raised him and Arti after his mother's passing, leading to tears from everyone.

title: Rape by one of a gang makes others responsible, equally punishable: SC
content: The Supreme Court has affirmed that in gangrape cases, proving each accused committed the complete act of rape isn't necessary for conviction. The court emphasized that if one member of a group commits rape with shared intent, all involved are equally responsible and punishable under Section 376(2)(g) of IPC, highlighting the principle of joint liability based on common intention.

title: Melinda Gates' advice to daughter after she cried over baby questions
content: Phoebe Gates, Bill Gates' daughter, revealed her mother Melinda's advice on handling investor bias regarding future motherhood while raising funds for her startup, Phia. Gates and her co-founder, Sophia Kianni, encountered questions about their plans to have children, highlighting a persistent bias in venture capital.

title: Raid 2 box office collection day 4: Ajay Devgn starrer crosses Rs 70 cr mark
content: Ajay Devgn's Raid 2 has stormed the box office, garnering an estimated Rs 70.75 crore during its opening weekend, fueled by strong advance bookings and positive reviews. The action-drama, directed by Rajkumar Gupta, features Devgn reprising his role as an IRS officer battling corruption, with Riteish Deshmukh as the antagonist.

title: 2 years on, Telangana gig workers' Bill catches Rajasthan's landmark law 'napping'
content: Telangana's draft bill on gig workers revives the debate once led by Rajasthan, where a pioneering 2023 law remains stalled. Gig workers in Rajasthan struggle with low earnings and lack of social security, as the promised welfare measures face bureaucratic delays. Amidst this, a cooperative framework and union efforts offer a glimmer of hope for a more equitable future.

title: Excise duty difference in states defeats spirit of ‘1 nation, 1 tax’
content: Alcohol prices in India vary significantly across states due to differing excise duties and taxes, with Goa having the lowest levies. This disparity undermines the 'one nation, one tax' principle, encouraging bootlegging and revenue loss for high-tax states. Industry bodies advocate for tax rationalization to promote sustainable revenue growth and discourage excessive consumption, but finance ministers are hesitant to relinquish taxation powers.

title: BJP: Rahul Gandhi ridiculed not just in India, but globally
content: BJP has praised a Sikh student for questioning Rahul Gandhi about the 1984 Sikh massacre during an interaction at Brown University. The student challenged Gandhi on reconciliation efforts with the Sikh community, citing past Congress actions and impunity for leaders like Sajjan Kumar. BJP criticized Gandhi's response and also attacked him for referring to Lord Ram as a mythological figure during the same event.

title: Centre announced caste census only after pressure from the Congress: Girish Chodankar
content: Speaking at a public meeting in Chennai, he says the the government at the Centre, led by Prime Minister Narendra Modi, has ‘surrendered’ to the people

title: Delay in commissioning Kommaghatta substation hampers power supply in Nadaprabhu Kempegowda Layout in Bengaluru
content: The Kommaghatta 66/11 KV substation, tendered in August 2021 and built at a cost of approximately ₹32 crore, was scheduled to be completed within 13 months

title: Delay in road projects to decongest Thripunithura draws flak from residents
content: Projects that are hanging fire include extension of the road that runs beneath the Kochi metro corridor to Hill Palace Road, and widening of S.N. Junction–Poothotta road; TRURA to launch stir

title: On SC’s Waqf hearing eve, DMK says 95% stakeholders before JPC was against amendments
content: On April 16, a Special Bench headed by CJI Khanna recorded an assurance by the government to neither denotify any waqf property, including waqf-by-user ones, nor make any appointment of non-Muslims to the Central Waqf Council or the States Waqf Boards

title: PM inaugurates seventh Khelo India Youth Games being held in Bihar
content: About 8,500 players will participate across 28 sports; the PM underscored the Games’ significance in providing a major platform for the nation’s youth; he urged visitors to sample Bihar’s famous litti chokha and makhana

title: Railway Protection Force seizes ganja worth ₹4.05 crore, liquor worth ₹13.16 lakh in crackdown on smuggling via rail
content: “Drug traffickers tend to misuse long-haul trains to shift narcotics across State lines, thinking they can evade detection due to the speed and anonymity the railway system offers,” said an SWR official

title: MBA graduate arrested in Bengaluru sexual assault case
content: The accused, identified as Srikanth, a resident of Devarabeesanahalli, is an MBA graduate working in a private company.

title: Victims of Murshidabad riots allege police broke doors, forcibly barged inside their premises
content: Parul Das wife of Hargobind Das and Pinki Das wife of Chandan Das sought protection and deployment of appropriate central forces for their safety and added that they were “left shaken and traumatized by the brazen conduct of the officers.

title: Youth’s body recovered from river in Kulgam; Mehbooba alleges ‘foul play’
content: Sources say victim helped in busting a hideout of militants recently; political parties demand a thorough investigation

title: Goa stampede: Fact-finding committee begins probe into incident; Governor meets victims’ kin
content: A police official said that the committee is currently recording the statements of senior officials in-charge of crowd management to understand what went wrong

title: Ranchi citizens write to CBFC Chairman Prasoon Joshi to clear ‘Santosh’ without any cuts
content: The viewers also issued an open letter to CBFC Chairman Prasoon Joshi to immediately allow the release of the film without any cuts. The open letter was signed by several renowned personalities including economist Jean Drèze.

title: Iran FM Araghchi to visit Pakistan, India this week, days after offering to mediate to reduce tensions
content: Iran’s Foreign Minister to hold Joint Commission Meeting with EAM Jaishankar in Delhi to discuss trade, Chabahar, U.S. sanctions

title: INDIA bloc decides to corner Bihar CM Nitish Kumar over corruption, list achievements of Grand Alliance
content: With the Bihar polls due later this year, bloc holds third meeting in Patna; RJD MP Manoj Jha says ‘there is no confusion about leadership’ in the alliance and ‘everyone knows who is their CM face’

title: NCERT new textbooks for Class 7 introduce games, activities rooted in Indian culture
content: From Ghorpadiche Shepoot to Nalugu Rallu Ata, a range of traditional Indian games make their way to the Physical Education book, while tie and dye and puppetry are included in the book for Vocational Education

title: Congress Uttar Pradesh chief stokes row with Rafale toy plane sporting lemon and chillies
content: U.P. Congress President criticises Government’s inaction on Pahalgam terror attack, questions delay in using Rafale jets against terrorists

title: Rajasthan MLA arrested for accepting ₹20 lakh bribe to drop questions in Assembly
content: The Anti-Corruption Bureau sleuths set up a trap to nab the MLA after the mine owner reached out with a complaint

title: Moving from a minority to a majority
content: As tensions rise between India and Pakistan after the Pahalgam attack in Kashmir, Pakistani Hindus in Delhi worry about their kin across the border. Alisha Dutta finds that for them, the thread of their lives runs through the improving or worsening relationship between the neighbouring countries with a history of love and hate

title: Sample fireworks set the sky aflame in Thrissur
content: Compliance with new PESO guidelines ensures safe distance between fireworks and spectators and allow more people to enjoy the show from Swaraj Round

title: A symphony of colour and craft: Chamayam expos attract huge crowds
content: Chamayappuras (exhibition halls of elephant accoutrements) of the Thiruvambady and the Paramekkavu Devaswoms opened on Sunday

title: Anvar’s political base crumples as Trinamool State leadership slams his UDF bid
content: The AITC State leadership has ridiculed Mr. Anvar, suggesting he was desperately trying to join the UDF ahead of the Nilambur byelection

title: Genome-edited seeds to mark beginning of second green revolution: Chouhan
content: These varieties will enhance production and also give environmental gains, says Minister; seeds to be made available to farmers in four-five years

title: Fire during PM’s visit: police launch probe
content: A fire broke out near Gannavaram Airport just before the arrival of Prime Minister; another fire mishap occurred at Tallayapalem village in Guntur district while Modi was delivering his speech

title: Woes of paddy growers continue amid uncertainty over PRS loans
content: Delay in issuing loans against paddy receipt sheets (PRS) impedes preparations for puncha farming season in Kuttanad and Upper Kuttanad

title: Anantapur libraries to become hubs of learning, creativity
content: Joint Collector Shiv Narayan Sharma, convened a meeting with officials from all 79 libraries, the Grandhalaya Samsthas to train children in drawing, painting and other creative disciplines

title: Election Commission to develop new digital interface for voters, other stakeholders
content: The new one-stop platform, ECINET, will integrate and reorient over 40 of the EC’s existing mobile and web applications, including the Voter Helpline app, Voter Turnout app, etc

title: Jaishankar says India is looking for partners, not preachers; highlights New Delhi's 'Russia realism'
content: Europe had ‘entered a certain zone of a reality check’, and must display some sensitivity and mutuality of interest for deeper ties with India, the External Affairs Minister said

title: Rain and thunderstorm take Chennai by surprise
content: The summer showers accompanied by thunder and lightning in several parts of Chennai brought temperature down by a few notches

title: Internal reservation: Survey to map SCs and their socio-economic and education levels in Karnataka to begin today
content: The caste census, conducted in 2015, has pegged the total SC population in Karnataka to be 1.09 crore or about 18.2% of the total population.

title: Council of CBSE Schools seeks rollback of tax hike for buses
content: The Council expresses concerns over the financial burden of the MVD’s mandate to install three CCTVs in each bus

title: Kerala unlikely to implead in Waqf Amendment Act case in Supreme Court
content: The Kerala government was one of the first in the country to fiercely oppose the legislation. The Kerala Waqf Board has filed a petition for being impleaded in the case. The court will hear the case on Monday

title: Jets' 'thrilling' rally bounces Blues in Game 7
content: Trailing 3-1 in the third period of Game 7 at home, with their season on the line, the top-seeded Winnipeg Jets rallied to stun the St. Louis Blues 4-3, securing a victory in their first-round series Sunday, and a second-round date with the Dallas Stars.

title: Warriors credit meeting for sparking Game 7 win
content: A day after an emotional players-only meeting, Buddy Hield became an unlikely playoff hero for the Warriors, leading the team early in Game 7 against the Rockets before Stephen Curry took over late.

title: Haliburton carves through Cavs in Game 1 stunner
content: The Pacers used a barrage of 3-pointers and a 22-point, 13-assist effort from Tyrese Haliburton to stun the top-seeded Cavaliers 121-112.

title: Source: Washington, D.C., to host 2027 NFL draft
content: The 2027 NFL draft will be held in Washington, D.C., on the National Mall, a source told ESPN, confirming an Axios report.

title: Scheffler ties PGA Tour scoring mark in CJ Cup win
content: Scottie Scheffler tied the PGA Tour's 72-hole scoring record Sunday, finishing at 253 and running away with an eight-shot victory at his hometown CJ Cup Byron Nelson.

title: Clark hits vintage 3 in return to Iowa with Fever
content: The fans got exactly what they wanted Sunday at Iowa's Carver-Hawkeye Arena: another vintage Caitlin Clark moment.

title: Inoue avoids disaster, stops Cardenas in thriller
content: Naoya Inoue avoided disaster in the second round to rally for a stop against Ramon Cardenas in defense of his undisputed super bantamweight championship.

title: McLaren's Piastri claims dominant win in Miami
content: Oscar Piastri extended his championship lead to 16 points with victory ahead of teammate Lando Norris at the Miami Grand Prix.

title: 💍 Eagles' Brown gets some Legend-ary help
content: The Philadelphia Eagles wide receiver will don his second ring in a several month stretch after helping the Eagles win Super Bowl LIX in February.

title: Kane's trophy pain: A full timeline as Bayern title ends career-long wait for silverware
content: It's finally over! Bayern Munich have won the 2024-25 Bundesliga title, and with it Harry Kane's career-long trophy drought has finally been broken.

title: Weekend review: Arteta zigs while everyone else zags
content: Mikel Arteta was the only UCL title contender to name a full-strength squad over the weekend -- and Arsenal lost. Will his gamble pay-off midweek? That and more in ESPN's Weekend Review.

title: Kane's long trophy wait ends as Bayern win title
content: Bayern Munich clinched their 33rd Bundesliga title on Sunday, giving forward Harry Kane the first major trophy of his senior career.

title: Palmer hits back at online 'idiots' as Chelsea win
content: Cole Palmer hit back at social media "idiots" after ending his goal drought in Chelsea's 3-1 win over Liverpool on Sunday.

title: Ancelotti: Clásico will be 'almost' decisive for title
content: Carlo Ancelotti said next weekend's Clásico will be "almost" decisive in the LaLiga title race after Real Madrid beat Celta Vigo 3-2 on Sunday.

title: Amorim defends young side: UEL final sole focus
content: Manchester United boss Ruben Amorim defended making wholesale changes to field the club's youngest ever Premier League lineup in Sunday's 4-3 loss at Brentford.

title: Mbappé brace vs. Celta Vigo keeps title race alive
content: Kylian Mbappé scored two goals as Real Madrid fought off a late comeback attempt from Celta Vigo to secure a 3-2 win on Sunday.

title: Kang's London City Lionesses promoted to WSL
content: London City Lionesses have secured promotion to the Women's Super League (WSL) with a 2-2 draw with fellow contenders Birmingham City.

title: Messi scores in Miami rout to snap losing streak
content: Lionel Messi struck the emphatic final goal as Inter Miami snapped a three-game losing streak with a 4-1 home win over the New York Red Bulls.

title: Solskjaer slams McTominay exit: 'It's beyond me'
content: Former Manchester United head coach Ole Gunnar Solskjaer has criticised Manchester United's decision to transfer Scott McTominay to Napoli last summer.

title: Haeran Ryu goes wire-to-wire in LPGA's return to Utah
content: Haeran Ryu made an 8-foot eagle putt during a flawless back nine that allowed her to pull away Sunday with an 8-under 64, giving her a five-shot victory at the inaugural Black Desert Championship in the LPGA Tour's return to Utah after a 61-year absence.

title: What this monumental coaching change means for San Antonio
content: What's next for San Antonio after Pop's move to the front office? What does Mitch Johnson bring? Our NBA insiders break down the news.

title: Joey Logano gets first win this season in OT at Texas
content: Reigning Cup champion Joey Logano surged ahead on the restart in overtime Sunday to win in the 11th race this year

title: Chelsea's midfield powers Blues past Liverpool, toward UCL
content: Enzo Fernández, Moisés Caicedo and Romeo Lavia looked like a UCL midfield in Chelsea's win over Liverpool.

title: Man United ratings: Garnacho, Amad bright sparks; young stars struggle
content: Alejandro Garnacho and Amad made sure Man United's defeat to Brentford didn't look as bad as it could have.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Madrid in talks with Arsenal star Saliba
content: Real Madrid have identified William Saliba as a possible future leader of the club. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Draft tiers at guard
content: Eric Moody goes through the different tiers at the guard position to help you in your 2025 fantasy women's basketball draft.

title: Hunter Brown leads all fantasy pitchers? Eugenio Suarez ends up a top-50 hitter? Don't be surprised

title: Luck Index 2025: Who needs luck on their side next season?
content: Turnover luck, coordinator upgrade, transfer portal haul? They all could lead to some upswings for a select few teams.

title: 'We've got the identity that fits us': Wisconsin turns back the clock to move forward
content: Wisconsin coach Luke Fickell is going back to the Badgers' roots in a crucial Year 3 for his program.

title: Bryson DeChambeau wins LIV Korea with back-9 birdie binge
